content: Mark Richards will give additional details underpinning our preliminary 2023 outlook, but at a high level, this outlook contemplates a similar headwind to the adjusted EBITDA that we experienced in 2022, related to our RCM transition activities or roughly $15 million. In terms of our quarterly earnings progression, we anticipate that our first quarter adjusted EBITDA will represent 16% to 18% of full year adjusted EBITDA, which is largely due to the normal seasonality of our financial results but also to our outlook for the impact of ongoing RCM transition activities. Finally, we do not anticipate any additional CARES funds in 2023, which in 2022 contributed $6.7 million in adjusted EBITDA, mostly in the first quarter of last year.
